organization.name: Community Impact Foundation
organization.mission: Advance equitable outcomes in education and economic opportunity through evidence-based programs and community partnership.

environment.content: The funding landscape is shifting toward outcomes-based grantmaking and trust-based philanthropy.
environment.source: Foundation landscape reports and funder conversations

environment.content: Regulatory requirements for 501(c)(3) compliance are increasing in complexity, particularly around donor-advised funds and lobbying limits.
environment.source: Legal counsel review and IRS guidance updates

environment.content: The communities we serve face compounding crises in housing affordability, food access, and educational equity.
environment.source: Community needs assessment 2024 and census data

environment.content: Collaborative, place-based approaches produce better outcomes than siloed program delivery.
environment.source: Program evaluation data and collective impact literature

capabilities.content: We have a strong track record of program delivery with measurable outcomes across three program areas.
capabilities.source: Annual program evaluations and funder reports

capabilities.content: Our board has deep expertise in finance, law, and community development.
Current staffing is adequate for existing programs but insufficient for planned expansion.

values.content: Equity in all program design, delivery, and evaluation.
Fiscal responsibility and transparent stewardship of donated resources.
Community voice centered in organizational decision-making.
Evidence-based practice grounded in both data and lived experience.

mission_targets.content: Increase annual program reach by 20% while maintaining outcome quality.
Diversify revenue so no single funder represents more than 30% of budget.
Achieve 90% or higher compliance score on all regulatory filings.
Publish annual impact report with disaggregated demographic data.

active_strategies.content: Implement outcomes measurement framework across all program areas.
Develop three-year strategic plan with community input process.
Build individual donor pipeline to reduce foundation dependency.

campaigns.content: Annual fundraising campaign targeting $500K in unrestricted funding.
Community listening tour across five neighborhoods to inform program design.

grants.content: Submit proposal to Department of Education for workforce development expansion.
Renew community foundation general operating support grant.
Apply for capacity-building grant to fund new data infrastructure.

principles.equity_mandate: All programs must demonstrate equitable access and outcomes across race, gender, disability, and income. Disparities trigger mandatory program review.
principles.data_sovereignty: Participant data is collected only for program delivery and evaluation. Participants may request deletion. Data is never sold or shared beyond reporting requirements.
principles.community_accountability: A community advisory board reviews all major program decisions. Annual public meetings present outcomes and solicit feedback.

custom.name: Fiduciary responsibility
custom.description: All financial decisions prioritize the organization's charitable mission and comply with IRS 501(c)(3) requirements.

custom.name: Donor accountability
custom.description: Restricted funds are used exclusively for their designated purpose. Donors receive accurate, timely reporting.

custom.name: Lobbying compliance
custom.description: All advocacy activities stay within IRS limits. No campaign intervention. Track and report lobbying expenditures.

custom.name: Conflict of interest
custom.description: Board and staff disclose conflicts. No self-dealing in contracts, grants, or compensation decisions.
